# CANZIM FinTrack - Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Document

## Product Requirement Document

---

**Project Name:** CANZIM FinTrack - Financial Management & Accounting System  
**Client:** Climate Action Network Zimbabwe (CAN Zimbabwe)  
**Developer:** bguvava (https://bguvava.com)  
**Database:** my_canzimdb  
**Architecture:** Single Page Application (SPA) with Laravel 12 & Vue.js 3  
**Version:** 1.0.0  
**Date:** November 12, 2025

---

## ðŸ“‹ **DOCUMENT OVERVIEW**

This MVP document outlines the complete development roadmap for CANZIM FinTrack, following a gradual and incremental stepwise approach from development environment setup to final deployment. Each module is broken down feature by feature with clear objectives, success criteria, and 100% completion requirements.

### **Development Principles**

1. âœ… **Secure Coding Practices** - Input validation, SQL injection prevention, XSS protection
2. âœ… **Scalability & Modularity** - Reusable components, service-oriented architecture
3. âœ… **Automated Testing** - 100% test pass rate with no regressions
4. âœ… **Cross-Browser Compatibility** - Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge support
5. âœ… **Mobile Responsiveness** - Full functionality on all devices
6. âœ… **Performance Optimization** - < 2s page load, < 500ms API response
7. âœ… **Rollback Strategy** - Git version control with tagged releases
8. âœ… **Documentation** - Comprehensive docs in `/docs/module_name/`
9. âœ… **Testing** - All tests in `/tests/module_name/` with 100% pass rate

### **Key System Requirements**

- **Branding & Logo:** Use official CANZIM logos from `.github/prompts/CANZIM_logo1.png` (primary) and `.github/prompts/CANZIM.png` (alternate). Copy to `/public/images/logo/` directory. Display in: sidebar header, landing page, login page, all PDF reports, email templates, footer
- **User Interface Modals:** ALL system modals, confirmations, alerts, and notifications MUST use SweetAlert2 library. No native browser alerts/confirms. Consistent styling: CANZIM blue theme (#1E40AF), custom icons, smooth animations
- **Smooth Transitions & Animations:** ALL interface elements must have smooth transitions (300ms duration). Page transitions fade-in (200ms), modal slide-in (250ms), button hover effects (150ms), form field focus animations, loading spinners, skeleton screens for data loading
- **Non-Technical User Friendly:** Simple language, clear labels, helpful tooltips, inline help text, guided workflows, confirmation before destructive actions, undo capabilities where possible, visual feedback for all actions
- **Performance & Speed:** < 2s page load, < 500ms API response, instant UI feedback, optimistic UI updates, debounced search (300ms), throttled scroll events, lazy-loaded images, cached API responses
- **PDF Exports Only:** All reports with standardized layout (header: logo + org name, content, footer: generated by + date/time + confidentiality + copyright)
- **Limited Search Filters:** Maximum 5 filters per search to optimize database queries
- **No Bulk Operations:** Except bulk delete/save for activity logs only
- **Document Actions:** View (opens in new tab) + Download (downloads file)
- **Session Timeout:** Auto-logout after 5 minutes of inactivity with SweetAlert2 modal confirmation
- **Developer Credits:** "Developed with â¤ï¸ by bguvava (bguvava.com)" in footer
- **100% Test Pass Rate:** All modules must achieve 100% test coverage with zero failures
- **Incremental Development:** Complete each module 100% before moving to next

### **Dashboard Architecture & SPA Requirements**

- **Centralized Dashboard Shell:** All modules operate within a unified dashboard layout with persistent navigation
- **Persistent Left Sidebar Navigation:** Fixed sidebar with hierarchical menu structure, collapsible with hamburger menu
- **Top Header Bar:** Global search, notification bell with badge counter, user profile dropdown menu
- **Role-Based Menu System:** Dynamic menu items based on user role (Programs Manager, Finance Officer, Project Officer)
- **Breadcrumb Navigation:** Shows current location within application hierarchy
- **Client-Side Rendering:** Vue.js 3 handles all routing and view rendering without full page reloads
- **API-First Architecture:** All data operations via RESTful API endpoints (/api/v1/\*)
- **State Management:** Pinia stores for centralized application state (auth, user, projects, notifications)
- **Single Page Application Flow:** Dashboard is main shell â†’ All modules are child views â†’ No separate standalone pages
- **Consistent UI/UX:** Shared components for navigation, headers, footers across all modules
- **Lazy Loading:** Route-based code splitting for optimal performance
- **Real-Time Updates:** Live data updates for dashboards and notifications
- **Responsive Grid Layout:** Mobile-first design with breakpoints (sm, md, lg, xl, 2xl)

### **Dashboard UI Components**

- **Info Cards/KPI Widgets:** Display key metrics with icons, values, percentage changes, and trend indicators
- **Interactive Charts:** Line charts (trends), bar charts (comparisons), donut/pie charts (distributions)
- **Color-Coded Elements:** Consistent color scheme (Blue #1E40AF primary, semantic colors for status)
- **Search Functionality:** Global search with keyboard shortcut (Ctrl+K / Cmd+K)
- **Notification System:** Bell icon with real-time badge counter, dropdown notification list
- **User Profile Menu:** Avatar dropdown with: Settings, Profile, My Messages, Lock Screen, Logout
- **Active State Indication:** Highlighted current page in sidebar navigation
- **Card-Based Layout:** Elevated cards with shadows for visual hierarchy
- **Progress Indicators:** Loading skeletons, spinners for async operations
- **SweetAlert2 Modals:** ALL system modals use SweetAlert2 - confirmations (delete, logout, submit), alerts (success, error, warning, info), input dialogs (quick forms), toast notifications (bottom-right position, 3s auto-close)
- **Smooth Animations:** Fade-in page transitions (200ms), slide-in modals (250ms), hover effects (150ms), ripple effects on buttons, smooth scrolling, loading animations, skeleton screens

### **Logout Process Workflow**

1. **User Initiates:** User clicks "Logout" button in profile dropdown
2. **Confirmation Modal:** SweetAlert2 modal appears with title "Confirm Logout", message "Are you sure you want to logout?", buttons [Cancel] [Logout]
3. **User Confirms:**
    - API call to /api/v1/logout endpoint
    - Backend invalidates Sanctum token, logs audit trail, clears session
    - Frontend clears Pinia stores, removes token from localStorage, resets state
    - Redirect to landing/login page with success notification
4. **User Cancels:** Modal closes, user remains logged in, no further action
5. **Auto-Timeout (5 min inactivity):**
    - Warning modal appears: "Your session will expire in 60 seconds"
    - User can click "Stay Logged In" to reset timer
    - No action â†’ Force logout â†’ Notification: "Logged out due to inactivity" â†’ Redirect to login

### **Branding & Logo Requirements**

- **Logo Files:** Use `.github/prompts/CANZIM_logo1.png` (primary full-color logo) and `.github/prompts/CANZIM.png` (alternate/white version)
- **Logo Locations:** Copy to `/public/images/logo/canzim_logo.png` and `/public/images/logo/canzim_white.png`
- **Logo Usage:**
    - **Sidebar Header:** Primary logo (150x50px max) at top of collapsed/expanded sidebar
    - **Landing Page:** Large primary logo (250x80px) in hero section
    - **Login Page:** Primary logo (200x65px) above login form
    - **Email Templates:** Primary logo (180x60px) in email header
    - **PDF Reports:** Primary logo (150x50px) in report header (top-left)
    - **Footer:** Small primary logo (100x35px) next to developer credits
    - **Favicon:** Generate 32x32px and 16x16px favicons from logo
    - **Loading Screen:** Animated logo (180x60px) with pulse effect while app initializes

### **SweetAlert2 Modal Standards**

- **Library:** SweetAlert2 v11+ (install via NPM: `npm install sweetalert2`)
- **Global Configuration:** Create `/resources/js/plugins/sweetalert.js` with CANZIM theme settings
- **Theme Customization:**
    - Confirm button: Blue #1E40AF background, white text, hover #1E3A8A
    - Cancel button: Gray #6B7280 background, white text, hover #4B5563
    - Icon colors: Success #10B981, Error #EF4444, Warning #F59E0B, Info #3B82F6
    - Border radius: 12px for modern look
    - Font family: Inherit from TailwindCSS (Inter/System fonts)
    - Animation: Smooth slide-down entrance (250ms), fade-out exit (200ms)

- **Modal Types & Usage:**
    1. **Confirmation Modals:** All destructive actions (delete, archive, cancel) require SweetAlert2 confirmation
        - Example: "Are you sure you want to delete this expense?" [Cancel] [Delete]
    2. **Success Notifications:** Show after successful operations (saved, submitted, approved)
        - Example: "Expense submitted successfully!" with checkmark icon, 2s auto-close
    3. **Error Alerts:** Display validation errors or operation failures
        - Example: "Failed to submit expense. Please check all required fields." [OK]
    4. **Warning Alerts:** Caution user about important information
        - Example: "This budget allocation will exceed your donor funding limit." [Cancel] [Proceed Anyway]
    5. **Info Modals:** Provide helpful information or guidance
        - Example: "Expenses over $1,000 require Finance Officer approval." [Got it]
    6. **Input Dialogs:** Quick data entry without full form page
        - Example: "Enter rejection reason:" [textarea] [Cancel] [Submit]
    7. **Toast Notifications:** Non-intrusive feedback for minor actions
        - Position: bottom-right, 3s auto-close, show icon, stack multiple toasts

- **Consistency Rule:** NEVER use native `alert()`, `confirm()`, or `prompt()`. Always use SweetAlert2.

### **Animation & Transition Standards**

- **Page Transitions:**
    - Route change: Fade-in new page content (200ms ease-in-out)
    - Exit animation: Fade-out old content (150ms) before new content loads
    - Loading state: Skeleton screens during data fetch (no blank white screens)

- **Modal Animations:**
    - SweetAlert2 entrance: Slide-down + fade-in (250ms ease-out)
    - SweetAlert2 exit: Fade-out + slide-up (200ms ease-in)
    - Backdrop: Fade-in dark overlay (200ms) with blur effect

- **Button Interactions:**
    - Hover: Scale 1.02x + slight shadow increase (150ms ease-out)
    - Active/Click: Scale 0.98x (100ms) then return (100ms)
    - Disabled: Opacity 0.5 + cursor not-allowed (no animation)
    - Loading state: Spinner inside button, text "Processing...", disabled

- **Form Field Animations:**
    - Focus: Border color transition blue (200ms), label slide-up if floating
    - Error state: Red border + shake animation (400ms), error message fade-in (150ms)
    - Success state: Green border + checkmark icon fade-in (200ms)
    - Input typing: Debounced validation (300ms after user stops typing)

- **Card Animations:**
    - Hover: Lift effect (translate-y: -4px) + shadow increase (200ms ease-out)
    - Click: Ripple effect from click point (500ms fade-out)
    - Data loading: Skeleton screen (gray pulsing animation) â†’ fade to real content (300ms)

- **List/Table Animations:**
    - New item added: Slide-in from top + highlight background (300ms) â†’ fade highlight (1s)
    - Item removed: Slide-out + fade-out (250ms) â†’ collapse height (200ms)
    - Sorting: Smooth reordering with position transitions (400ms ease-in-out)
    - Pagination: Fade-out old data (150ms) â†’ fade-in new data (200ms)

- **Chart Animations:**
    - Initial render: Animate from zero to value (800ms ease-out) with stagger (50ms delay per bar/point)
    - Data update: Smooth transition to new values (600ms ease-in-out)
    - Hover: Highlight data point + show tooltip with fade-in (150ms)

- **Notification Animations:**
    - Toast enter: Slide-in from right (300ms ease-out)
    - Toast exit: Slide-out to right + fade-out (250ms ease-in)
    - Badge counter: Scale bounce effect when count increases (300ms)

- **Performance Guidelines:**
    - Use CSS transitions/transforms (GPU-accelerated) not JavaScript animations
    - Prefer `transform` and `opacity` for best performance
    - Use `will-change` sparingly for complex animations
    - Debounce rapid events (scroll, resize, typing) to prevent janky animations
    - Respect user's `prefers-reduced-motion` setting (disable decorative animations)

### **User Experience for Non-Technical Users**

- **Simple Language:** Avoid technical jargon, use clear everyday language
    - âŒ "API request failed" â†’ âœ… "Unable to connect. Please check your internet connection."
    - âŒ "Validation error" â†’ âœ… "Please fill in all required fields marked with \*"

- **Visual Feedback:** Every action must have immediate visual response
    - Button click: Ripple effect + loading state if async operation
    - Form submission: Disable form + show spinner + "Saving..." message
    - File upload: Progress bar with percentage + "Uploading..." message
    - Success: Green checkmark + success message + auto-close/redirect

- **Helpful Tooltips:** Add tooltips to icons, abbreviations, and complex fields
    - Hover over (?) icon shows explanation in tooltip (e.g., "YTD = Year To Date")
    - Form field help text below input (e.g., "Enter amount in USD without commas")

- **Guided Workflows:** Multi-step processes use step indicators
    - Progress bar showing: Step 1 of 4 â†’ Step 2 of 4 â†’ etc.
    - "Back" and "Next" buttons clearly visible
    - Save draft option for lengthy forms

- **Error Prevention:**
    - Required fields marked with \* (red asterisk)
    - Inline validation as user types (with 300ms debounce)
    - Disable submit button until form is valid
    - Clear error messages next to problematic fields

- **Confirmation Before Destructive Actions:**
    - Delete: SweetAlert2 "Are you sure?" with warning icon
    - Cancel: "You have unsaved changes. Discard changes?" [Go Back] [Discard]
    - Logout: "Are you sure you want to logout?" [Cancel] [Logout]

- **Undo Capabilities:** Where possible, allow undo for recent actions
    - Toast notification: "Expense deleted" [Undo] button (5s timeout)
    - Soft delete: Items moved to trash/archived, can be restored

- **Loading States:** Never show blank screens, always show loading indicators
    - Skeleton screens for content (gray pulsing boxes matching final layout)
    - Spinners for buttons and small operations
    - Progress bars for file uploads and long operations
    - Text: "Loading your dashboard..." / "Processing payment..."

- **Empty States:** Helpful messages when no data exists
    - "No expenses yet. Click 'Add Expense' to get started."
    - "No search results found. Try different keywords."
    - Include helpful illustration/icon and clear call-to-action button

- **Keyboard Shortcuts:** For power users, but don't require them
    - Ctrl/Cmd+K: Global search
    - Ctrl/Cmd+S: Save form
    - Escape: Close modal
    - Show keyboard shortcuts in help menu

- **Mobile-Optimized:** Large touch targets (min 44x44px), easy thumb navigation
    - Bottom navigation bar on mobile for primary actions
    - Swipe gestures for common actions (swipe to delete, pull to refresh)
    - Responsive form layouts (single column on mobile)

## ðŸ”„ **MODULE COMPLETION PROCESS** (CRITICAL - APPLY TO ALL MODULES)

### **Mandatory Workflow for Every Module**

Each module MUST follow this systematic process to ensure 100% completion and quality:

#### **1. Task Breakdown & Sequencing**

- âœ… Break down module into small, manageable tasks (to avoid chat length limits)
- âœ… Execute tasks sequentially, one at a time
- âœ… Complete each task 100% before moving to next
- âœ… Verify task completion with immediate testing
- âœ… Never skip tasks or implement partial solutions

#### **2. Development & Implementation**

- âœ… Build backend first: Migrations â†’ Models â†’ Controllers â†’ Services â†’ API Routes
- âœ… Build frontend next: Components â†’ Pages â†’ Forms â†’ API Integration
- âœ… Implement features according to requirements table (REQ-XXX)
- âœ… Follow coding standards from `.github/prompts/coding_style.json`
- âœ… Use SweetAlert2 for all modals, confirmations, alerts
- âœ… Add smooth animations to all UI elements (transitions, hover effects)
- âœ… Display CANZIM logo from `/public/images/logo/canzim_logo.png` where applicable

#### **3. Testing (100% Pass Rate Required)**

- âœ… Write feature tests for all API endpoints
- âœ… Write unit tests for all services and business logic
- âœ… Write component tests for all Vue components
- âœ… Run tests after each implementation: `php artisan test --filter=ModuleName`
- âœ… Achieve 100% test pass rate (NOT 98%, NOT 99%, MUST be 100%)
- âœ… Fix all failing tests immediately before moving forward
- âœ… Verify zero regressions (old tests still passing)
- âœ… Save all tests in `/tests/module_name/` directory

#### **4. Documentation (Mandatory)**

- âœ… Create module documentation folder: `/docs/module_name/`
- âœ… Document module overview: `/docs/module_name/README.md`
- âœ… Document API endpoints: `/docs/module_name/api-endpoints.md`
- âœ… Document components: `/docs/module_name/components.md`
- âœ… Document database schema: `/docs/module_name/database-schema.md`
- âœ… Document user workflows: `/docs/module_name/user-workflows.md`
- âœ… Include code examples, request/response samples, screenshots (if applicable)

#### **5. Navigation Menu Updates (Critical)**

- âœ… Update sidebar navigation menu in `DashboardLayout.vue` component
- âœ… Add new menu items for this module with appropriate icons (FontAwesome)
- âœ… Configure role-based menu visibility:
    - **Programs Manager**: Full access to all menu items
    - **Finance Officer**: Access to financial modules only (Dashboard, Expenses, Cash Flow, POs, Donors, Reports, Settings)
    - **Project Officer**: Access to project modules only (Dashboard, My Projects, My Expenses, Documents, Comments)
- âœ… Update menu item badge counters if applicable (e.g., pending expenses count)
- âœ… Add active state highlighting for current module
- âœ… Test navigation works for all three user roles

#### **6. Quality Assurance Checklist**

Before marking module as complete, verify:

- âœ… All requirements (REQ-XXX) implemented 100%
- âœ… All API endpoints working and returning correct responses
- âœ… All UI components rendering correctly on desktop, tablet, mobile
- âœ… All forms validating properly (frontend + backend)
- âœ… All modals using SweetAlert2 (no native alerts)
- âœ… All animations smooth (page transitions, hover effects, loading states)
- âœ… Logo displayed correctly where required
- âœ… All tests passing at 100%
- âœ… All documentation complete in `/docs/module_name/`
- âœ… Navigation menu updated for all roles
- âœ… No console errors or warnings
- âœ… No PHP errors in Laravel logs
- âœ… Module performs within requirements (< 2s load, < 500ms API)

#### **7. Git Commit Strategy**

- âœ… Commit after completing each task (not entire module at once)
- âœ… Use conventional commit format: `feat(module): description (REQ-XXX)`
- âœ… Examples:
    - `feat(expenses): create expense submission form (REQ-310)`
    - `test(expenses): add expense submission tests (REQ-310)`
    - `docs(expenses): add API documentation (REQ-310)`
- âœ… Push to GitHub after each significant milestone

#### **8. Module Sign-Off Criteria**

A module is considered 100% complete ONLY when:

1. âœ… All requirements in requirements table implemented
2. âœ… All tests passing at 100% (zero failures)
3. âœ… All documentation complete in `/docs/module_name/`
4. âœ… Navigation menu updated and tested for all roles
5. âœ… Module success criteria (listed at top of module) all met
6. âœ… Code committed to Git with proper commit messages
7. âœ… Module reviewed and verified working end-to-end

#### **9. Task Size Management (Avoid Chat Length Limits)**

To prevent hitting chat length limits:

- âœ… Implement maximum 5-7 requirements per conversation turn
- âœ… For large modules (20+ requirements), break into phases:
    - **Phase 1**: Backend (migrations, models, controllers, API)
    - **Phase 2**: Frontend (components, forms, pages)
    - **Phase 3**: Testing & Documentation
    - **Phase 4**: Navigation menu + final verification
- âœ… Request user confirmation before proceeding to next phase
- âœ… Save progress frequently with Git commits

#### **10. No Shortcuts Policy**

- âŒ NEVER skip tests "to save time"
- âŒ NEVER skip documentation "it's obvious"
- âŒ NEVER implement 80% and call it done
- âŒ NEVER leave TODOs or placeholders
- âŒ NEVER say "the rest is similar" without implementing
- âŒ NEVER merge code with failing tests
- âœ… ALWAYS implement 100% complete, production-ready code
- âœ… ALWAYS achieve 100% test pass rate
- âœ… ALWAYS complete all documentation
- âœ… ALWAYS update navigation menu

## MODULE 1: DEVELOPMENT ENVIRONMENT SETUP

### **Module Objectives**

1. Configure VS Code with required extensions for Laravel & Vue.js development
2. Set up local development environment (XAMPP/MySQL)
3. Initialize Laravel 12 project with Vue.js 3 integration
4. Configure Git version control and repository structure
5. Set up testing framework (PHPUnit/Pest + Vitest)
6. Configure code quality tools (ESLint, Prettier, PHP CS Fixer)

### **Module Success Criteria**

- âœ… VS Code fully configured with all required extensions
- âœ… Laravel 12 project running successfully on localhost
- âœ… Vue.js 3 with Vite compiling without errors
- âœ… MySQL database `my_canzimdb` created and connected
- âœ… Git repository initialized with proper `.gitignore`
- âœ… All dependencies installed (composer.json, package.json)
- âœ… Testing frameworks operational with sample test passing
- âœ… Documentation folder structure created (`/docs/`)
- âœ… Test folder structure created (`/tests/`)

**Mandatory Completion Requirements (Apply to ALL Modules):**

- âœ… All tasks executed sequentially with 100% completion (no partial implementations)
- âœ… All module tests passing at 100% (saved in `/tests/environment_setup/`)
- âœ… All module documentation complete (saved in `/docs/environment_setup/`)
- âœ… Sidebar navigation menu updated for all user roles (if applicable)
- âœ… Zero regressions (all previous tests still passing)
- âœ… Code committed to Git with conventional commit messages

## ðŸŽ¯ **FINAL PROJECT SUMMARY**

**CANZIM FinTrack MVP - Complete Development Roadmap**

### **Total Requirements: 740**

- Part 1 (MODULEs 1-4): 174 requirements - Foundation & Authentication
- Part 2 (MODULEs 5-8): 268 requirements - Core Financial Modules
- Part 3 (MODULEs 9-14): 298 requirements - Advanced Features & Deployment

### **Estimated Timeline: 16 Weeks**

- Weeks 1-2: Development environment, database, authentication, user management
- Weeks 3-8: Dashboard, projects, budgets, expenses, cash flow, purchase orders
- Weeks 9-14: Donors, reporting, commenting, documents, settings, audit trail
- Weeks 15-16: Testing, optimization, deployment, UAT, launch

### **Key Deliverables**

1. âœ… Fully functional financial management ERP system
2. âœ… Role-based access control (3 roles: Programs Manager, Finance Officer, Project Officer)
3. âœ… 8 core modules: Dashboard, Projects, Financial Management, Donors, Reporting, User Management, Commenting, Documents
4. âœ… 20+ database tables with relationships and foreign keys
5. âœ… Comprehensive PDF reporting with standardized CANZIM layout
6. âœ… 3-tier approval workflow for expenses
7. âœ… Real-time dashboard with 30-second polling
8. âœ… Complete audit trail and activity logging
9. âœ… Document management with versioning
10. âœ… Commenting system with @mentions
11. âœ… 100% test coverage with 740+ passing tests
12. âœ… Complete documentation (setup, architecture, modules, API, deployment)
13. âœ… Production deployment on cPanel subdomain with SSL
14. âœ… User training and support system

### **Technical Stack**

- **Backend:** Laravel 12, PHP 8.2+, MySQL 8.0+, Redis caching
- **Frontend:** Vue.js 3, TailwindCSS, Alpine.js, Chart.js, Pinia
- **Authentication:** Laravel Sanctum with 5-minute session timeout
- **PDF Generation:** DomPDF/TCPDF with standardized layouts
- **Testing:** PHPUnit/Pest (backend), Vitest (frontend)
- **Version Control:** Git with GitHub
- **Deployment:** cPanel subdomain with SSL

### **System Specifications**

- **Color Scheme:** Vibrant blue (#1E40AF, #2563EB, #60A5FA, #1E3A8A)
- **Database Name:** my_canzimdb
- **Session Timeout:** 5 minutes of inactivity
- **Max Search Filters:** 5 per search
- **File Upload Limits:** Documents 5MB, Receipts 5MB, Attachments 2MB, Avatars 2MB
- **Accepted File Types:** PDF, DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, JPG, PNG
- **PDF Exports Only:** All reports with standardized layout
- **No Bulk Operations:** Except bulk delete for activity logs
- **Document Actions:** View (new tab) + Download
- **Performance Targets:** < 2s page load, < 500ms API response

### **Quality Assurance**

- âœ… 100% test pass rate (740 tests) - NO 98%
- âœ… Zero regressions between modules
- âœ… Complete documentation for all modules
- âœ… Cross-browser compatibility verified
- âœ… Mobile responsiveness tested
- âœ… Security vulnerabilities resolved
- âœ… Performance benchmarks met
- âœ… User acceptance testing completed
- âœ… Stakeholder approval obtained

## ðŸŽ¨ **SYSTEM-WIDE DESIGN & UX STANDARDS**

### **Critical Implementation Notes**

âš ï¸ **ALL modules and features throughout this entire system MUST adhere to the following standards:**

#### 1. **Logo & Branding (100% Compliance Required)**

- âœ… Use ONLY official logo files: `/public/images/logo/canzim_logo.png` (primary) and `/public/images/logo/canzim_white.png` (alternate)
- âœ… Display logo in: Sidebar header (150x50px), Landing page (250x80px), Login page (200x65px), PDF reports header (150x50px), Email templates (180x60px), Footer (100x35px)
- âœ… Favicon generated from logo: favicon.ico, favicon-32x32.png, favicon-16x16.png in `/public/`
- âœ… Logo must have subtle animation on page load (fade-in + scale, 500ms ease-out)
- âœ… Consistent CANZIM blue color scheme: Primary #1E40AF, Secondary #2563EB, Accent #60A5FA, Dark #1E3A8A

#### 2. **SweetAlert2 Modals (Mandatory - No Exceptions)**

- âœ… NEVER use native browser `alert()`, `confirm()`, or `prompt()` - ALWAYS use SweetAlert2
- âœ… ALL confirmations (delete, logout, submit, cancel) use SweetAlert2 confirmation modal
- âœ… ALL success messages use SweetAlert2 success modal with green checkmark icon (2-3s auto-close)
- âœ… ALL error messages use SweetAlert2 error modal with red X icon, user must click "OK"
- âœ… ALL warnings use SweetAlert2 warning modal with yellow exclamation icon
- âœ… ALL info messages use SweetAlert2 info modal with blue "i" icon
- âœ… Toast notifications for non-critical feedback (bottom-right, 3s auto-close, stacking enabled)
- âœ… Consistent button styling: Confirm button blue #1E40AF, Cancel button gray #6B7280
- âœ… 12px border radius, 250ms slide-down animation, backdrop blur effect

#### 3. **Smooth Transitions & Animations (All UI Elements)**

- âœ… Page transitions: Fade-in (200ms ease-in-out) when navigating between routes
- âœ… Modal animations: Slide-down + fade-in (250ms ease-out) on open, fade-out + slide-up (200ms ease-in) on close
- âœ… Button hover: Scale 1.02x + shadow increase (150ms ease-out)
- âœ… Button click: Scale 0.98x (100ms) then return (100ms), ripple effect from click point
- âœ… Form field focus: Border color transition to blue (200ms), label slide-up if floating
- âœ… Form field error: Red border + shake animation (400ms), error message fade-in (150ms)
- âœ… Card hover: Lift effect (translate-y: -4px) + shadow increase (200ms ease-out)
- âœ… List item add: Slide-in from top + highlight background (300ms) â†’ fade highlight (1s)
- âœ… List item remove: Slide-out + fade-out (250ms) â†’ collapse height (200ms)
- âœ… Chart animations: Animate from zero to value (800ms ease-out) with stagger (50ms delay per element)
- âœ… Loading states: Skeleton screens (gray pulsing) â†’ fade to real content (300ms)
- âœ… Toast notifications: Slide-in from right (300ms), slide-out to right (250ms)
- âœ… Respect `prefers-reduced-motion` setting - disable decorative animations for users who need it

#### 4. **User-Friendly Interface (Non-Technical Users)**

- âœ… Simple language: No technical jargon, clear everyday language
- âœ… Visual feedback: Every button click, form submission, data save shows immediate feedback
- âœ… Helpful tooltips: Add (?) icons with explanations for complex fields
- âœ… Inline help text: Below form fields explaining what to enter
- âœ… Required fields: Mark with red asterisk (\*), show clearly
- âœ… Inline validation: Real-time feedback as user types (debounced 300ms)
- âœ… Error prevention: Disable submit until form valid, confirm before destructive actions
- âœ… Clear error messages: "Please enter a valid email address" not "Validation failed"
- âœ… Loading indicators: Never blank screens - always skeleton, spinner, or progress bar
- âœ… Empty states: Helpful messages with call-to-action when no data exists
- âœ… Undo capability: Allow undo for deletions (soft delete with restore option)
- âœ… Success feedback: Green checkmark + success message + optional auto-redirect
- âœ… Large touch targets: Minimum 44x44px for mobile buttons/links

#### 5. **Performance Standards (Speed & Responsiveness)**

- âœ… Page load: < 2 seconds from click to visible content
- âœ… API response: < 500ms for all endpoints
- âœ… Instant UI feedback: Optimistic UI updates (update UI immediately, sync with server in background)
- âœ… Debounced search: 300ms delay after user stops typing before searching
- âœ… Lazy loading: Images, components, routes loaded only when needed
- âœ… Code splitting: Separate bundles per route for optimal initial load
- âœ… Cached responses: Cache frequently accessed API data (5-minute TTL)
- âœ… Smooth scrolling: 60fps animations, no janky transitions

#### 6. **Consistency Across All Modules**

- âœ… Same navigation structure in all modules (persistent sidebar + header)
- âœ… Same button styles: Primary (blue), Secondary (gray), Danger (red), Success (green)
- âœ… Same form layouts: Labels above inputs, consistent spacing, aligned buttons
- âœ… Same table styles: Striped rows, hover effects, sortable headers
- âœ… Same card styles: White background, rounded corners, subtle shadow, hover lift
- âœ… Same color coding: Success (green), Error (red), Warning (yellow), Info (blue)
- âœ… Same font sizes: Headings (2xl, xl, lg), Body (base), Small (sm, xs)
- âœ… Same spacing: Consistent padding, margins, gaps using Tailwind scale
